title: Conversion Factor for Grams to Kilograms (and Kilograms to Grams)

steps.title: Divide the number of grams by 1,000.
steps.content: Divide the number of grams by 1,000. There are 1,000 grams in 1 kilogram, so all you have to do is divide by 1,000 to get from grams to kilograms. [1] X Expert Source David Jia Academic Tutor Expert Interview. 14 January 2021. Set up the equation using fractions, if needed. Put the number of grams over 1 and divide it by 1 kg / 1,000 g (which is the conversion factor). The grams will cancel out to leave you with an answer in kilograms. Make sure to label your answer with the correct units. [2] X Research source Example 1: 20,000 grams ÷ 1,000 = 20 kilograms 20 , 000 g 1 / 1 k g 1 , 000 g {\displaystyle {\frac {20,000g}{1}}/{\frac {1kg}{1,000g}}} 20 , 000 1 / 1 k g 1 , 000 {\displaystyle {\frac {20,000}{1}}/{\frac {1kg}{1,000}}} 20 , 000 / 1 , 000 = 20 k g {\displaystyle 20,000/1,000=20kg} Example 2: 9,135 grams ÷ 1,000 = 9.135 kilograms 9 , 135 g 1 / 1 k g 1 , 000 g {\displaystyle {\frac {9,135g}{1}}/{\frac {1kg}{1,000g}}} 9 , 135 1 / 1 k g 1 , 000 {\displaystyle {\frac {9,135}{1}}/{\frac {1kg}{1,000}}} 9 , 135 / 1 , 000 = 9.135 k g {\displaystyle 9,135/1,000=9.135kg}

steps.title: Shift the decimal point 3 places to the left as an alternative.
steps.content: Shift the decimal point 3 places to the left as an alternative. The metric system is a base 10 system of measurements. In other words, metric units are always a multiple of 10 apart. Grams and kilograms are a multiple of 1,000 apart, so you can simply move the decimal point 3 places to the left. Remember that for a whole number, the decimal point is to the right of the ones place. Fill in any blank spaces with zeroes, as needed. [3] X Research source Example 1: 37 grams = 37 . → 3 . 7 → . 37 → . 037 kilograms Example 2: 4,000 grams = 4,000 . → 400 . 0 → 40 . 00 → 4 . 000 kilograms

steps.title: Multiply the number of kilograms by 1,000.
steps.content: Multiply the number of kilograms by 1,000. There are 1,000 grams in 1 kilogram, so all you have to do is multiply by 1,000 to get from kilograms to grams. [4] X Expert Source David Jia Academic Tutor Expert Interview. 14 January 2021. Set up the equation using fractions, if needed. Put the number of kilograms over 1 and multiply it by 1,000 g / 1 kg (which is the conversion factor). The grams will cancel out to leave you with an answer in kilograms. [5] X Research source Don’t forget to label your answer with the correct units. Example 1: 5 kilograms x 1,000 = 5,000 grams 5 k g 1 x 1 , 000 g 1 k g {\displaystyle {\frac {5kg}{1}}x{\frac {1,000g}{1kg}}} 5 1 x 1 , 000 g 1 {\displaystyle {\frac {5}{1}}x{\frac {1,000g}{1}}} 5 x 1 , 000 = 5 , 000 g {\displaystyle 5x1,000=5,000g} Example 2: 16.505 kilograms x 1,000 = 16,505 grams 16.505 k g 1 x 1 , 000 g 1 k g {\displaystyle {\frac {16.505kg}{1}}x{\frac {1,000g}{1kg}}} 16.505 1 x 1 , 000 g 1 {\displaystyle {\frac {16.505}{1}}x{\frac {1,000g}{1}}} 16.505 x 1 , 000 = 16 , 505 g {\displaystyle 16.505x1,000=16,505g}

steps.title: Shift the decimal point 3 places to the right as an alternative.
steps.content: Shift the decimal point 3 places to the right as an alternative. Because the metric system is a base 10 system of measurement, metric units are a multiple of 10 apart. Kilograms and grams are a multiple of 1,000 apart. So, all you have to do is move the decimal point 3 places to the right to convert from kilograms to grams. Fill in any blank spaces with zeroes and label your answer with the correct units. [6] X Research source Example 1: 50 kilograms = 50 . → 500 . → 5000 . → 50000 . 0 grams Example 2: 1.957 kilograms = 1 . 957 → 19 . 57 → 195 . 7 → 1957 . 0 grams

steps.title: What is a gram?
steps.content: What is a gram? A gram (g) is a unit of measurement for mass in the metric system (also known as the International System of Units, or SI). The base metric unit of mass is 1 gram. A regular paperclip has a mass of about 1 gram. [7] X Research source One gram is also approximately equivalent to the mass of one cubic centimeter of water. [8] X Research source

steps.title: What is a kilogram?
steps.content: What is a kilogram? A kilogram (kg) is the standard unit of mass in the metric system. It’s approximately equal to the mass of 1,000 cubic centimeters of water. [9] X Research source

steps.title: How are grams and kilograms related?
steps.content: How are grams and kilograms related? The metric system is a base 10 system of measurements. In other words, metric units are always a multiple of 10 apart, meaning they get larger or smaller by a power of ten (10). A unit's prefix tells its power. The prefix "kilo-" means that the unit has one thousand (1,000) of the base unit. [10] X Research source 1 kilogram (kg) is equal to 1,000 grams (g) and 1 gram (g) is equal to 0.001 kilograms (kg).
